page.title: 20DIALECT IN N.W.NEWCASTLE.
page.content: Visitors to our area sometimes find it hard to understand our "Geordie" language.Several words are expressed differently but there are also words and phrases which are unique to Tyneside.For example: "Haway man" ={"Come on" "Wor ye gannin?" ={"Where are you { } {going?" "Am gannin hyem" ={"I am going home"} "Gan canny" ={"Go carefully" "Ah diven na" ={"I don't know" "Aall reet" ={"All right"} "Wye aye man" ={"Of course" "Nowts the marra"={"Nothing is the { matter"} "Howay the lads" ={A football chant "Pet"and"Hinny" ={Terms of endearment "Wor lass" ={"My wife" "Am gannin doon {"I'm going into the the toon wi the = {city centre with bairns" {the children"
